data.title: [Feature Request] Folding for include/import statements
data.body:
Android Studio (based on IntelliJ) has the ability to fold Java imports:
![includes-folding](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/3987812/4325174/7e0c3f04-3f62-11e4-9eaa-1d196c87e550.gif)
This would be nice to have in Atom for Java and possibly other languages.

data.title: Tab rendering fails during theme package update
data.body:
After updating the in-use theme, the tabs appear to lose their styles.

![screen shot 2014-09-18 at 12 32 45 pm](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/122102/4325180/8b1c521a-3f62-11e4-8672-1817a9bf7516.png)

data.title: Add Linux installation instructions
data.body:
This adds installation instructions for installing atom on Linux. It advises the use of [Nix](https://nixos.org/nix), which has the advantages that it doesn't require root and works on every Linux distribution. (The [Nix atom pkg](https://github.com/NixOS/nixpkgs/blob/master/pkgs/applications/editors/atom/default.nix) should be updated sometime though)

It also mentions the .deb file on the release page.

What do you think?

data.title: Can't indent line following line with bad indentation
data.body:
Safe mode, with soft tabs off and a tab length of 4:

![screen shot 2014-09-18 at 14 51 47](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/1759837/4320850/f5774c46-3f3a-11e4-8a39-dc7bc11e4fbc.png)

Pressing tab at the cursor position results in nothing happening. Indenting with `cmd+]` works normally.

It seems that you can only indent a maximum of `floor(spaces / tabLength)` times.

e.g. if I use 6 spaces with a tab length of 4, I can indent once, then it stops working:

![screen shot 2014-09-18 at 14 49 46](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/1759837/4320815/adc08d72-3f3a-11e4-8e31-9a48be2b8a8d.png)

If the number of spaces is a multiple of the tab length, it works normally.

data.title: Exclude Vcs Ignored paths
data.body:
I know this issue has been raised previously but that was due to them not un-ticking the checkbox however, mine is un-ticked and the contents within the folders do not show.

![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/1407863/4318898/97ddffb4-3f24-11e4-9b1f-0173b8f3eace.png)

You can see that both `node_modules` and `vendor` are set to be open however, no contents shown. If I remove the folders from my .gitignore they then show. Any ideas?

data.title: Font size differences
data.body:
Below is a screenshot of Atom and Sublime Text, both using the same font.  I use a font size of 11 in Sublime Text but in Atom it's set to 14 to get a similar size font.

(This also highlights font rendering differences where Atom looks a bit fuzzy compared to Sublime Text, although I know that's being tracked in another issue)

Atom version 0.129

![atom-sublime](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/422013/4317748/a81ce6dc-3f16-11e4-89d9-c6293dd88fba.png)

data.title: Ability to log in with GitHub account to sync Atom config
data.body:
It would be great if I could login with a GitHub account and have Atom store my settings either in Dropbox, or GitHub as a repository, or in some way that is easy to access and maybe even sync them across all my installations of Atom so that when I download a new package, it is downloaded everywhere. Another suggestion is to be able to manually export a .atomconfig JSON file that I could just import to Atom at any point to configure settings, install packages, change themes, etc.

I think having the first would be more important for most people, but for anyone who is offline and for anyone who likes to keep their own backups in other places, the manual settings export is really useful.

If this sounds like a good idea to Atom contributors and consumers, I'd like to help out with the PR to make this happen.

data.title: Opening files with activatePane false has no effect.
data.body:
# The issue

Using `atom.workspace.open("file.txt", {activatePane: false})` still activates the pane. I would expect the file to open in the background, and not bring itself up to be the active editor, however that's what it does.

I looked around in the source code for [`workspace.openUriInPane`](https://github.com/atom/atom/blob/master/src/workspace.coffee#L304), and it looks like this isn't implemented yet. It also looks like you have a depreciated option called `changeFocus`, which also didn't do what I had expected. 
## Steps to produce
1. Open a file
2. Open your console
3. Enter: `atom.workspace.open("", {activatePane: false})`
4. See that it still activates the new file when it opens it
## What I was expecting

I was expecting the file to open in the background, and not hide any of the currently open files.

data.title: Editor being recognized as Settings
data.body:
![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/2766036/4313936/ba1eca7c-3ed4-11e4-9633-aed1640d9eba.png)
Note how the titlebar displays as `Settings - c:\Servers\blah`.  Same goes for the bottom-left of the status bar.  There's also no language selection or git status stuff available.  I can edit normally though.  The issue doesn't fix itself if I open a new tab-that'll also be recognized as a Settings tab.  Opening up an actual Settings tab will perform as expected, but the issue persists after closing it.  Might be unrelated, but it looks like I can't open up any package tabs either (eg Timecop).

This happened right after I went into Settings and disabled/removed some of my plugins (including Wrap Guide, if that helps).

Windows 7 x64, v0.129.0.

data.title: Rename DisplayBufferMarker to Marker
data.body: Also use the docs from the new core `Marker` class.

data.title: "Invisible" devtools mode
data.body:
When I have the devtools closed, sometimes they pop up to tell me about an error that occurred. But there's never a stack trace, so this error message isn't very actionable. It's my understanding that stacktraces are only captured when the devtools are open before the error is thrown.

One solution to this is to always have the devtools open, but that takes up screen space. Another is to pop them out of the Atom window, but that gets confusing if you have multiple windows open.

It would be nice to have some kind of "invisible" devtools mode where it will still capture stacktraces (and do whatever else it does), but otherwise have the editor work normally. There's probably some kind of performance penalty incurred by having the devtools open, so maybe this could be behind a flag like `atom --debug`.

data.title: Deprecate custom DOM events
data.body:
### Deprecated view events

The following events will now be deprecated when calling `.on` on these views with information about the corresponding model event that should be used instead.
#### WorkspaceView (atom.workspaceView)
- beep (added `Atom::onDidBeep`)
- cursor:moved
- editor:attached
- editor:detached
- editor:will-be-removed
- pane:active-item-changed
- pane:active-item-modified-status-changed
- pane:active-item-title-changed
- pane:attached
- pane:became-active
- pane:became-inactive
- pane:item-added
- pane:item-moved
- pane:item-removed
- pane:removed
- pane-container:active-pane-item-changed
- selection:changed
- uri-opened
#### EditorView
- cursor:moved
- editor:attached
- editor:detached
- editor:will-be-removed
- selection:changed
#### PaneView
- cursor:moved
- editor:attached
- editor:detached
- editor:will-be-removed
- pane:active-item-changed
- pane:active-item-modified-status-changed
- pane:active-item-title-changed
- pane:attached
- pane:became-active
- pane:became-inactive
- pane:item-added
- pane:item-moved
- pane:item-removed
- pane:removed
- selection:changed
### Remaining custom view events
#### EditorView
- editor:display-updated

data.title: Soft wrap broken around 127/128?
data.body: It looks to me like the soft wrapping of lines broke somewhere about 127 or 128.  On 129, I see the grey guide out at 80 characters but no wrapping is occurring. "Soft wrap at preferred line length" is checked and the default at 80 character statement is visible in grey in the box.  Thanks.

data.title: Support variation sequences
data.body:
Expand support for high/low surrogate pairs by also supporting variation sequences so that they are treated as tokens with a screen delta of 1 but a buffer delta of 2. This allows them to be moved over and deleted as if they were a single character even though they have a string length of 2.

``` js
'✔︎'.length
2
'✔︎'.charCodeAt(0)
10004
'✔︎'.charCodeAt(1)
65038
```

http://www.alanwood.net/unicode/variation_selectors.html

Closes #3564

data.title: Deleting a special character takes 2 key strokes
data.body: When I insert a special character and later I want to delete it, it takes 2 keystrokes to delete not one Here's the code I tested with ``` ✔︎ ✖ ``` On Mac, 0.129

data.title: Pressing enter for long cause CPU to shootup 100%
data.body:
Performance regression while entering new lines.
After 2-3 secs CPU will shoot up to 100% of pressing and holding enter.
Tested with --safe, after about 1000 lines Atom gives up , quit with a crash. 
Also tested with auto-save turned off.

data.title: "Install Shell Commands" doesn't work on Windows 7
data.body:
After launching Atom as Administrator and firing `Ctrl+Shift+p` > `Window: Install Shell Commands` (with no errors), then opening `cmd` and `mingw32` (from `git bash`) and running `apm` and `atom` commands:

![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/497926/4301990/0410fc84-3e55-11e4-9d33-9afafe330a17.png)

No changes in `system path`:
![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/497926/4302095/35109dd4-3e56-11e4-8484-39fd3eb7a932.png)

nor in `user path`:
![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/497926/4302064/e8365df0-3e55-11e4-8771-ff2d384d9ce8.png)

Everywhere in docs, it says:

> launch Atom and run the `Atom > Install Shell Commands` menu to install the `apm` and `atom` commands

Where to find that, since there's no `Atom` in menu:
![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/497926/4302461/3fb8ef76-3e5a-11e4-8252-afff007386d5.png)

data.title: Feature Request: Config location path
data.body: what would be cool is a configurable config location path so that i can sync all my packages and settings in the cloud... by putting the path in my dropbox folder

data.title: Scroll bar problems
data.body:
I've had some problems with the scroll bars in more recent releases.  I posted the issues in the atom discussion board (https://discuss.atom.io/t/scroll-bars-are-missing/12152) and was directed to post here.

The issues:
- When code lines in a given file extend beyond the preferred line length, the vertical scroll bar does not appear.  If the file is edited so that no lines extend beyond the preferred line length, the vertical scroll bar immediately appears.
- The horizontal scroll bar is only present when scrolled all the way to the bottom of a file.

These problems have occurred for me since at least v0.127.0 (and possibly older) on Mac OS X 10.9.

data.title: normalizeIndentOnPaste deletes indent
data.body:
`normalizeIndentOnPaste` is supposed to [convert tabs to spaces, or spaces to tabs](https://atom.io/docs/v0.59.0/customizing-atom#configuration-key-reference).  Instead it [removes all indentation from the start of the line](https://discuss.atom.io/t/normalize-indent-on-paste-doesnt-work-as-expected/3503/5).

In a coffee file, try cutting and then immediately pasting the middle line:

```
    console.log "foo"
    console.log "bar"
    console.log "baz"
```

You get:

```
    console.log "foo"
console.log "bar"
    console.log "baz"
```

which is definitely note what `normalizeIndentOnPaste` should be doing.

data.title: Add leading/trailing whitespace classes to hard tab tokens
data.body:
#2304 no longer cleanly merges but the issue is still present where leading/trailing hard tabs don't get a `trailing-whitespace` or `leading-whitespace` CSS class applied to them.

Closes #2304

data.title: Pathwatcher node module missing?
data.body: Hi, I tried building Atom on Windows 7 x64 and found I couldn't build it unless adding the atom/node-pathwatcher project to $PROJECT_DIR/atom/node_modules. Is the atom project missing a dependency then for building correctly on Windows?

data.title: Register commands to disable/enable packages
data.body:
Instead of having to dig deep into the settings view, there should probably be top level commands to enable/disable each package.

That way if you want to turn of something like spell check, you can do it from the command palette (`Cmd-Shift-P`) instead of having to click around the settings view.

Refs https://github.com/atom/spell-check/pull/33

data.title: typing "]" folds current line
data.body:
Hi,

I have an annoying behavior that prevents me to type the character "]". Instead it folds current-line.

On Azerty layout the ] can be typed with : AltGr + 0 .In the keybindings the current line folding should be triggered with Ctrl + Alt + ]. So there is some kind of conflict...

Thanks,

Atom@0.127.0, Windows 7 FR, azerty keyboard layout

data.title: Atom cursor getBufferPosition and getScreenPosition return the same?
data.body: In the console, I'm experimenting with cursor positions, and it seems that `.getBufferPosition()` and `.getScreenPosition()` return the same thing, even though the documentation says that `.getScreenPosition()` returns "the screen position of the cursor as an Array." and `.getBufferPosition()` returns "the current buffer position as an Array."
